caption: This place deserves 0 stars. We decided to try this Italian place for a friend's birthday celebration.. We were super excited about this place that we traveled a hour just to go here. The carriages were an eye catcher and we managed to get a carriage seat. The food took a very long time to come. Once the food came, it looked delicious and we were exited to dig in. Instead,  we were extremely disappointed. This has been one of the worst restaurant experience. Every single  lamb dish that we ordered had an extremely strong smell which made it unbearable to eat, the pasta has so much salt that it ruined the taste buds. Worst of all 2/4 pastas has hair inside them. We made a complaint against this and it was taken out of the bill. In addition to this they charged us extra for something we never ordered. Overall this place was a dissapointment and I hope the manager takes this feedback into consideration.

If this restaurant is owned by the same person as Milk and Honey next door there is definitely something wrong. I took my grandchildren to eat at the grounds which they ordered burgers, I wanted an omelet which is served by milk and honey.long story short I wasn't allowed to eat in the carriages where my grandchildren were eating because I wanted an omelet, I was willing to order more food from the grounds just so I could sit with my grandchildren but the manager told me that I couldn't.  So I had to call the children's mother to come and sit with them while I sat across from them.This was the first and last time I will let my family eat at the  Grounds.

Salty or bland, LATE food, embarrassing to treat a friend here because it was so late. The devile himself cried tears of pure salt into my pasta. Sadness in a bowl. Oh and small portions for an expensive price.

The service was awful, the waitress didn’t know the menu, took forever to get our food, the food was cold then took 10 minutes for them to bring us silverware.  They never checked on us once the food came, I will never ever go back again, the worst service I have ever had
bad restaurant 0/0 please avoid

The setup of this restaurant is very nicely done and is Halal. They have a cute little heated Cinderella carriage outside the restaurant that’s def an eye catcher. However, I have to say I was extremely disappointed in everything they had to offer. The owner named either Matt or Max seemed very annoyed and had no clue on what was going on and apparently it’s the same owner as Milk & Honey. First off, we called and asked for reservations but the waitress named Stephanie said that there are no reservations due to covid. We get to the restaurant, requesting to be seated in the nice Cinderella carriage and she tells us that we need reservations. Then, we proceeded to be seated in a shed where “there was heat”. The room was ice cold and definitely could’ve used more heating because their “strongest” heater wasn’t bussin’. As the day went on, they brought out one dish of lamb chops that was ice cold @6:45pm. We didn’t get the other four dishes til @7:27pm. At this point we request to be seated inside due to the room freezing off which they did accommodate but were very upset doing it. It’s okay the servers had little to zero experience as Stephanie expressed she works on the cafe side so I started to expect the most inadequate customer service received. Taylor was the only one that was super friendly and efficient. Now, that we were seated inside and waiting on the rest of the food, there are no plates given or proper utensils. The rib-eye steak was a bit burnt that it tasted like charcoal. The spicy chicken jalapeño pizza wasn’t spicy and was burnt. The Gnocchi with pesto and Mac and Cheese were good but mediocre. The food was awfully cold for the most part. I will cut them some slack because they do look like they just opened. Proper staffing is ideal especially if you’re advertising halal Italian food. I do not recommend it with the current customer service they have. I will be back in 6 months to do another review.

My friend came to America he was excited for his first American meal. He spent all the money he brought with him from Bangladesh hoping to have an authentic Italian experience in America. After the meal he wanted to go back to Bangladesh and he wanted to contact ice for free transport and eat other food. He said he had ate better food off the streets of Bangladesh. He said he could have bought two wives back home for the amount of money he spent on the food. The heating in the outdoor area was so bad he said he was warmer in the winters of Bangladesh when his auntie used to warm their family by breathing warm air on them. The waiter was very nice and was clearly working very hard.

I come to America last week and not worth it. I not enjoyed it at all and was too much money. The waitor was bootifull more then woman in my country. I enjoyed her look more then food. The food price too high, I can sleep with woman in my country for money I spent on food. Go to diffrent restaturt. Better quality everywhere.  Eat dirt from Africa before this American food.
I tried hard to vote one star but I could not. The mamosas were 7 dollars for a glass of orange juice 😡. A shot glass. Very upset

If I can rate this establishment half a star, I would. The food was cold, the proportions were WAY too small. I even had to go to the grocery and make my own drinks because the Mamosa was just orange juice and sprite were $7 and no refill.

Had a superb experience!!!  Owner was very nice . Food was good and price was very reasonable given it’s all halal. Owner was very passionate person. Told him I had come to celebrate my wife’s bday and he brought cake without even asking, that’s going above and beyond and that cake was great!!
Fresh pizza with a Mediterranean twist. Cool booths. Delicious food. Wait staff could be quicker 🤔. China serviced tea, yummy. Would revisit.

I just had my first lunch here today after seeing several post on social media about this place. It looks like right now they are still not doing indoor dining, which is fine. The little "pods" outside are super cute, clean and very warm. The food and service is really good as well. The only issue (which is not major) is that they don't serve any alcohol. The menu looks limited, but the prices are very reasonable. I will definitely be back again!
This restaurant is not good not talk right liar I’m coming going there he said wait 15 minutes then 5 minutes 1 hour stil wait he is not right talk

Came here on a Thursday night and there was a good amount of customers, but still ample seating. I sat outdoor and it was comfortable temperature and warm lighting. Shout out to Martha and the other servers for being amazing wait staff. Got the red sangria, corn tostada, and short rib entree. Corn tostada was good but I don't know if it's $4 good. Short rib was fairly good but could be more well balanced; gnocchi inside the dish was cut too large, the dish was more soupy than I expected, but the meat was cooked well.
The pizza is delicious
The iced coffee and the almond croissant 🥐 were very good. My friends got lattes and also enjoyed them. The outside patio was also really nice.
The service is always speedy, excellent atmosphere, very welcoming employees. I will visit again when I arrive nearby.
Delicious branzino. Would have preferred less potatoes and more roasted tomato. The real tragedy is that this beautiful restaurant has no liquor license. Definitely craving wine with my meal.
Great for brunch and always empty when milk and honey is crowded! I want to try for dinner!

Came here for brunch. The place was very understaffed. The waitress was not familiar with the menu. We also waited 25 minutes and didn’t even get a water and had to ask for it again. The food was good but came cold. Empty plates stayed on the table and nobody took them. The place is beautiful but the service is very poor and I hope they change it.

My first visit and I felt in love with this little place. Only few items in the menu but the food is delicious. The server was very attentive. Just look at the pictures and visit the place. It’s worth every cent. 😊
Food and service was good.
Excellent food and service. Thoughtful, aesthetically pleasing decor. Brunch was delicious,  definitely planning on going back for dinner sometime.
Really good tasty food, with great portion sizes. Went on a Sunday and it was pretty quiet and I loved that.
Great customer service. Excellent food. Fresh ingredients.

The kitchen mixed up our Pasta orders and forgot to add what I asked them to add to the pasta. In addition to this the lunch menu only seemed to have pizza and pasta no appetizers or anything else. It was pretty empty even for lunch which was very disappointing as we’ve been going to Milk and Honey for years and thought that this would live up to the same standards. Hope that it gets better so I can change my review. Will be giving it another try for dinner sometime...
Great place in the neighborhood.

Our waiter was unfriendly, was not familiar with items on the menu. Grilled vegetables were delicious, the pizza was not. The pizza maker skimped on the toppings making it so unsatisfying. Would not go back again.
The hamburger and pasta is delicious, the service is great. Will come back for more. And the restaurant design is wonderful and unique.

Food was ok and the interior was quite eclectic. At one point I saw a rolling pin hanging from the ceiling . It's pretty and clean inside the restaurant with the huge brick oven as the center piece. Pricey for a Brooklyn restaurant. Fantastic waiting service. Nice quiet atmosphere that's good for pairs and groups to come and enjoy.

Maybe has some potential, but currently unreasonably long wait to get drinks and food, inexperienced staff, food arrived cold.  We arrived for brunch on Saturday, around 1pm. The place was not very busy and we got a table right away. The waiter forgot to order our drinks with the bar, it took them 30 minutes to bring our coffee. Had to ask four different people to bring me some lemon. Some of them I asked twice. After a while our eggs arrived, but they were cold. And I don't mean lukewarm, I mean cold. It probably would have tasted good if it was warm. My eggs were served on a wooden board, which is not ideal for sunny side up :)
Highly over priced for potato gnocchi. Definitely not enough Pasta for what was being charged.Not worth it at all.

This is without a doubt the best restaurant in Ditmas Park at the moment. Attention to detail here is unlike anything I’ve seen in the area—or even manhattan for that matter. We went here on the opening night and loved every dish. We ordered the italian nachos and a margarita pizza as appetizers. Then we ordered potato gnocchi and duck as our entrees. Everything was freshly prepared. The pasta is even made in house in their open kitchen. So you can see everything that’s happening behind the scenes. This is definitely a restaurant that the neighborhood should support.
So good! Loved the margarita pizza and gnocchi. Delicious and a great addition to the neighborhood!

The best place and best atmosphere in Brooklyn❤️ it’s like I’m in Williamsburg. I recommend everyone to check this new gem out you will love it!  The pizza and pasta is all handmade, the freshest ingredients. So happy for you Max👌🏻
